translated: The Mansion Chapter
The Divine Mansion of a Male Spirit
The Chapter with Pāyāsi
The Divine Mansion of Kuṇḍalī (II)
“Adorned with garlands and perfumes, well dressed,
with earrings, hair and beard trimmed,
with bracelets on his upper arms, the famous one,
in his divine mansion, is like the moon.
Divine beautiful lutes play,
eight-stringed, well-tuned, lovely,

analyzed: dibbā ca kaññā tidasa carā uḷārā
translated: divine women, the best of the thirty-three,
dance and sing, delighting him.
You have attained the divine powers, you are of great power,
what merit did you make as a human being?
By what are you so radiant,

analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ ca te sabbadisā pabhāsati iti
translated: and your beauty shines in all directions?”
The deva was delighted,
this is the result of that action.
“When I was a human being,
seeing well-behaved ascetics,
accomplished in knowledge and conduct, famous,
learned, virtuous, and confident,

analyzed: annam ca pānam ca pasanna cittaḥ
translated: with a serene mind, I gave them food and drink,
generously giving with respect.
Because of that, I have such beauty,🔽…

analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ ca me sabbadisā pabhāsati iti
translated: And my radiance shines in all directions.”
The Second Mansion of Kuṇḍalī, the Ninth
